title: Real Estate Skip Tracer
job_overview:
???? Real Estate Research Assistant (Probate, Divorce, Skip Tracing Specialist)
Are you a skilled online researcher with a knack for finding off-market real estate leads? We're looking for a Real Estate Research Assistant who can dig deep into public records, court filings, and databases to uncover properties with motivated sellers due to probate, divorce, or financial distress.

This is a key role that will directly feed high-quality leads to our acquisitions team.

???? What You’ll Do:
Research public probate records to identify recently deceased property owners

Search divorce filings and public records to find homes tied to divorce cases

Use skip tracing tools and public data to track down owner contact info

Identify distressed property owners (tax delinquent, pre-foreclosure, code violations)

Organize and input data into spreadsheets or our CRM

Deliver consistent, accurate lead lists with full property and owner details

Communicate closely with our lead manager to align on criteria

???? Ideal Candidate Has:
Experience with probate, divorce, or real estate lead research

Knowledge of public records, county websites, court filings, etc.

Strong skip tracing skills using tools like BeenVerified, LexisNexis, TLO, or similar

High attention to detail — data accuracy is critical

Organized, focused, and self-directed

Experience in U.S. real estate markets a major plus

????? Tools You Should Be Comfortable With:
Online public record systems (county assessor, probate courts, etc.)

Skip tracing platforms

Google Sheets / Excel

Gmail, Google Docs, Google Calendar

Communication tools: Skype, Telegram, WhatsApp, etc.

Send us the following:

Your resume

A short message explaining your experience with real estate research or skip tracing

Any sample work or tools you've used (if available)

What is the answer to 10+10? Put the answer in the subject when applying. Thank you
